description.value:
This dashing travel- (and beer-) stained feathered robe is the result of magic experimentation gone awry. Dared to create a robe that would continually cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Feather Fall]{Feather Fall} during a brainstorming session at a local pub, a young wizard got the enchantment wrong. Instead of a robe that would let its wearer float through the air, they got....this:

When you first invest the robe, and whenever you make your daily preparations, roll [[/r 1d6]] and consult the following list to determine the type of feathers. 1: crow; 2: duck; 3: ostrich; 4: chicken; 5: goose; 6: peacock. With each step taken, huge amounts of feathers sprout forth from the robe with great force. The feathers make you @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} from all other creatures, but also conceal all other creatures from you. Of course, you cannot use this concealed condition to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Hide]{Hide}.

Note: This item originates from the 2022 Paizo April Fools Blog post.
